result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Terrell Weston Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Parenting classes.

AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Terrell Weston Jr
Current: 5184 N LOVERS LANE RD APT 4, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 05-27-2015)
Prior: 9060 North 85th Street Apt#3, Milwaukee, WI 53224

Defendant Anthony Terrell Weston in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Per telephone call from Probation Agent.  Case is adjourned from 4-01-2016 to 5-13-2016 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Anthony Terrell Weston in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

As to Count 2:
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months concurrent.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
-Serve 25 days consecutive in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 4/8/2016 at 1:15 pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge and domestic violence surcharge during the period of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.


RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Terrell Weston in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 3, 4 and 5 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNTS 1 and 2.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTYon COUNTS 1 and 2.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNTS 1 and 2 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may not possess a firearm or body armor.   

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.
